list_definition.definition: of, or belonging to, the time before recorded history

list_ex_of_english: A lot of abandoned ancient cities with many pre-historic instruments and human skeletons has been found in several parts of the modern-day province.
What research seems to be proposing is that there is greater continuity of culture in the prehistoric period.
The region has been inhabited since pre-historic times with tumuli in the heathland to the south of the village.
The cave was discovered in the 18th century, although it is presumed that it was used by pre-historic people.
Magnetism as a property of matter has been known since pre-historic times.
In pre-historic times, the area was a huge lake, of which only three small lakes remain today.
Archaeologists found many pre-historic instruments and human skeletons in many parts of the district.
We often find older landscape elements in the periphery of the village areas, such as prehistoric settlement sites and sacral sites.
